summary:
Happy birthday my dear Chris 💖 Can’t believe you’re 38, you’re such a cutie baby boy 😍 Love you! 
I wish you to finally find...
body:
Happy birthday my dear Chris 💖 Can’t believe you’re 38, you’re such a cutie baby boy 😍 Love you!

I wish you to finally find that one and only woman who’s gonna become Mrs Chris Evans (ofc it’ll break all our hearts, but we want you to be happy) and give the world lots of mini Chrises 😅

P.S. Thank you for making me smile every day ☺️

summary:
Happy 38th birthday, Christopher Robert Evans! (June 13, 1981)  


I like the feeling of making things. It’s very very...
caption:
Happy 38th birthday, Christopher Robert Evans! (June 13, 1981)


 I like the feeling of making things. It’s very very rewarding. And filmmaking is that type of experience, where you’re forced to collaborate with so many people. You’re involved in the beginning to end, you’re involved with so many elements, and when it’s done, you’re like I made this movie.

blog.name: my-emotional-self
blog.title: Chris Evans Fanfiction
blog.description: Emily ~ 32 ~ Minnesota ~ Chris Evans Fanfiction Writer ~ 18+ NSFW Blog ~

title: Forever Ago Chapter 4
body:
Pairings: Chris Evans x OFC

Warnings:  Angst, Swearing

Summary: After losing touch with your childhood best friend after graduation, he comes crashing back into your life 15 years later. The feelings you’ve had for him never left you.  But do you forgive him for all those years he ignored you?  Or do you decide he lost his chance with you for good?

“Jess,” his soft voice bringing you back to reality.  

Slowly you turned around, your gaze moving up his body and to his face.  When your eyes mixed with his, it felt like the wind was knocked out of you.  He was more handsome than ever.  From all the years playing Captain America, he really bulked up his body.  His muscles pressed tightly against his black t-shirt; drool practically seeping from your lips at the sight of him.  

“Hi,” you breathed out softly.  Chris stuffed his hands into his front pockets, a lop sided grin on his face.  

“Hey.”  You were unsure of what to even say, and it seemed the same for Chris.  You were able to read him like an open book as a look of guilt popped onto his beautiful face.  “How have you been?”  he asked with a slight nervous tinge to his voice.  

You shrugged, looking down at your feet.  “I’ve been ok.”  Looking back into his eyes, you just wanted to scream and kiss him at the same time. “You?”

Chris’ eyes met yours; a hint of sadness behind them.  “Umm, yeah I’ve been good.  Working a lot so that’s kept me pretty busy.”

“Mmmm,” was all you managed to say with a raise of your brows.  Of course he was ‘so’ busy that he couldn’t even bother to text or call you back after so many years.  

“Look Jess…” he began to say when the door to the balcony opened.  

“Hey Jess, you wanna play another round of beer pong and be on my team this time?” Chace asked with a smile.  Your own relieved smile spread across your face.  

“I’d love to,” you replied. Looking back to Chris, you gave him a tight smile.  “I’ll see you around.”  It nearly broke your heart to be so short with your responses to him; but he broke your heart years ago by just forgetting about you.  

~~~

“YES!” you cheered, raising your hands in the air as you sunk the last ball making you and Chace the winners.  

“Holy shit girl you are the best beer pong partner EVER!” he roared as he picked you up in his arms and spun you around.  You giggled but soon felt yourself get dizzy from all the drinking and spinning around. Luckily Chace set you down quickly.

Glancing around the apartment, you saw Chris and Sebastian sitting together on the couch.  They were talking quietly to one another.  You couldn’t help but think what they were talking about.  

~~~

“I can’t believe she didn’t tell me,” Sebastian sighed, taking another sip of his drink.  “We’ve been so close for the past decade and she never brought it up.”

Chris looked to the floor; his elbows on his knees.  “Don’t sweat it too much man.  It’s my fault really.”

Sebastian looked at Chris, his brows raised in question.  “What the hell does that mean?

Chris let out a deep sigh, shaking his head.  “I mean I royally fucked up Seb.  We remained close for a few years after I moved here to go to school.  But once I got my first acting job, I just became so busy wanting to be with all these women that I slowly stopped texting her.”

Sebastian’s mouth hung open. “Are you fucking kidding me right now? You’ve known the girl since you were what, five, and you just decide to up and ignore her?  She’s like the greatest person on this planet!”

“You don’t think I know that Seb?  She’s like the best thing that ever happened to me.”

“Then how could you fuck this up?  I mean, shit looked tense between the two of you, but I could see the chemistry immediately. What the hell happened?”

Chris let out another deep breath, clasping his hands together.  “Hollywood happened.  One minute I’m texting and calling her every day.  The next I get an actress girlfriend who is insecure as fuck about me being close with a friend who’s a girl.  And I just….fuck I don’t know.  The celebrity life got the best of me when I was in my 20’s.”

The two men looked over to see Jessica playing beer pong.  She was smiling and laughing along with the other guys, having the time of her life.  Chris smiled but still felt sad and like a total asshole for what he did to her. From such a young age, his heart belonged to her.  He used to think the two of them would get married one day; have a family together. But he knew he fucked that all up now.

“Jess is really forgiving. Just talk to her.  Tell her the truth.”

“I don’t know man.  I mean, it’s been fucking years since I’ve talked to her before today.  There’s no excuse I could say to make this any better.”

“If I know Jessica the way I do, she’s getting tired and going to want to go home.  Offer to take her home and talk to her.  Just seeing you two next to each other-you seem like the perfect pair.”

That got a chuckle from Chris.  

In a matter of minutes, Jessica came up to Sebastian, telling him she was ready to go home.  

~~~

A yawn escaped your lips as you looked at your phone.  Yep, time to get your ass back home and into bed.  

Sebastian was still talking to Chris, and no matter how much you didn’t want to go over there, you had to say goodbye to Sebastian.  

Grabbing your purse and jacket, you made your way through the small crowd and to the couch where the boys were sitting.  

“It’s getting late. I’m going to head home,” you said with a soft smile.  

You saw Sebastian nudge Chris.  “I can take you home,” Chris pipped up with hopeful eyes.  

“No it’s ok.  I was going to order an Uber,” came your curt reply.

“I insist.  Please. I have a rental car.  You don’t need to waste money on an Uber.”

As much as your mind was screaming at you to say no, to just walk away from this right now, your heart was telling you the complete opposite.  Nodding your head, you gave Sebastian a hug.  

“We’re going to talk about this,” he whispered in your ear.  You knew he was mad about you not telling him about Chris, and you damn well knew you were going to get an earful about it; probably bright and early tomorrow.

You and Chris walked silently downstairs and out into the cool night air.  You followed him until he stopped in front of his rental, opening the passenger car door for you.  

Without a moment’s notice, your breath hitched at the sight of the front passenger seat.  Your palms began to sweat as your breathing came up short. Chris noticed and you were quickly wrapped up in his strong arms.  

“Shit Jess.  I’m such an idiot.  I completely forgot about this,” Chris’ voice was soothing.  

After your parents were killed by a drunk driver, it had been difficult for you to be anywhere near the front seat of a car.  You usually took trains, Ubers, or walked everywhere.  There wasn’t much a need for cars in New York City.  The last time you were in the front seat of a car was after your parents’ accident and you had a panic attack.  Lisa was driving, Chris was in the backseat and she had to pull over to calm you down.  Ever since then, it’s only been backseats for you as you just felt more comfortable that way.

“Do you want to sit in the backseat?” Chris’ voice broke you from your thoughts.  You gave him a slight nod as he closed the door and opened the door to the backseat.  

You got in and buckled yourself as Chris got into the driver’s seat.  You gave him your address and he typed it into his phone.

Before you knew it, you were pulled up outside your apartment building.  

“Thanks for the ride Chris,” you said as you unbuckled yourself.  

“Can I come in?  Can we talk?” Chris asked from the front seat; his eyes glued to you in the rearview mirror.  

Your motions stilled as you fought with what to say.  You wanted nothing more than to bring him inside and have your way with him. Whether that meant to kiss him, or to scream at him, you had no idea.  In the end, your heart won over.  

“Yeah.  Ok,” you softly spoke.  

Pulling your keys from your purse you unlocked the door to the building.  Chris trailed behind you as the two of you climbed the stairs to your floor.  You turned to look at him, giving him a soft smile as you continued walking down the hall. As you reached your apartment door, you sighed deeply before unlocking the door.  

The two of you walked in and immediately Chris began to look around at his surroundings.  It wasn’t much, but it was home.  Your apartment had one bathroom and one bathroom.  Just big enough for you.  Rent was expensive in New York City, but as a photographer who photographed celebrities and special events, you made enough to live comfortably.  

Chris began to look at your shelves and the pictures they bestowed.  As much as you wanted to have pictures of the two of you; which you did have, you had to take them down as it hurt too much to look at them.  Instead, you had pictures of your parents, and ones with you and some of the Evans family.  

He stopped in front of one picture with you, Lisa, Carly and Shanna.  Chris took it off the shelf, as he smiled.  “This is a great picture.”  

Walking over to him, you chuckled.  “That was a great day.  Us girls went to the spa and got pampered.  I need another one of those days.”

“You know, my mom talks about you constantly whenever I’m on the phone with her.  She’s always bragging about how good of a photographer you are.  She misses you.”

That broke your heart. You hadn’t seen Lisa or any of the Evans siblings in nearly a year.  It was too hard to go back home.  Your house had been rented out since you moved to New York City; not ready to sell it just yet.  In fact, you were going back home to Sudbury next week as the tenants moved out and you were finally ready to sell.  It was a big house and you no matter how much you wanted to keep it; New York was home to you now and you couldn’t imagine living in such an elaborately big house by yourself.  

“Yeah I know.  But I’ll see her next week,” you remarked. Chris looked at you with furrowed brows. “I’m selling the house so I need to get some cleaning and staging done.”

Chris looked sad at your words.  But there was nothing he could do to change your mind.  

“Have you put it up for sale yet?” he asked.  

Shaking your head, you replied.  “Not yet. I wanted to get some cleaning done. I’ll be there next week and then I have a real estate agent coming over the week after that.”

Chris put the picture back onto the shelf before turning to you.  His eyes looked pained as he took you in.  The two of you staring at one another; no words spoken.  He was so beautiful and no matter how hard you tried to block all the feelings, you knew deep down, he still held your heart.  

Your chin began to quiver as you turned your back to him.  Breathing deeply, you clenched your eyes shut.  It hurt you so much to be this close to him, yet knowing he threw you away after just a few years of being in the spotlight.  

Turning back to face him, your eyes were glossed over with tears.  “Why Chris?” you choked out.  “Why did you just toss me aside like I meant nothing to you?”

Chris slumped onto the couch, placing his head into his large hands.  He took a few deep breaths before looking up at you with tear filled eyes.  

Tag List: @chrisevansfanfic @jinoraskies @patzammit @brastrangled @miss-cap21 @princess-evans-addict @pumbibaby @guera31 @kanupps06 @zohoffman @the-real-kellymonster @white-chocolate-mocha-fan @remember-that-one-blog @sincerelyfan @hispeculiartreasure @libbitinasdeath @projectxhappiness @ssweet-empowerment @sfreeborn @poerebel @jjlevin @badassbaker @sophiealiice @mrs-captain-evans @crushed-pink-petals @supernatural-girl97 @laochbaineann @esoltis280 @coffeebooksandfandom @joannie95 @3dsaunt

Chris’ eyes met yours; a hint of sadness behind them.  “Umm, yeah I’ve been good.  Working a lot so that’s kept me pretty busy.”

“Mmmm,” was all you managed to say with a raise of your brows.  Of course he was ‘so’ busy that he couldn’t even bother to text or call you back after so many years.  

“Look Jess…” he began to say when the door to the balcony opened.  

“Hey Jess, you wanna play another round of beer pong and be on my team this time?” Chace asked with a smile.  Your own relieved smile spread across your face.  

“I’d love to,” you replied. Looking back to Chris, you gave him a tight smile.  “I’ll see you around.”  It nearly broke your heart to be so short with your responses to him; but he broke your heart years ago by just forgetting about you.  

~~~

“YES!” you cheered, raising your hands in the air as you sunk the last ball making you and Chace the winners.  

“Holy shit girl you are the best beer pong partner EVER!” he roared as he picked you up in his arms and spun you around.  You giggled but soon felt yourself get dizzy from all the drinking and spinning around. Luckily Chace set you down quickly.

Glancing around the apartment, you saw Chris and Sebastian sitting together on the couch.  They were talking quietly to one another.  You couldn’t help but think what they were talking about.  

~~~

“I can’t believe she didn’t tell me,” Sebastian sighed, taking another sip of his drink.  “We’ve been so close for the past decade and she never brought it up.”

Chris looked to the floor; his elbows on his knees.  “Don’t sweat it too much man.  It’s my fault really.”

Sebastian looked at Chris, his brows raised in question.  “What the hell does that mean?

Chris let out a deep sigh, shaking his head.  “I mean I royally fucked up Seb.  We remained close for a few years after I moved here to go to school.  But once I got my first acting job, I just became so busy wanting to be with all these women that I slowly stopped texting her.”

Sebastian’s mouth hung open. “Are you fucking kidding me right now? You’ve known the girl since you were what, five, and you just decide to up and ignore her?  She’s like the greatest person on this planet!”

“You don’t think I know that Seb?  She’s like the best thing that ever happened to me.”

“Then how could you fuck this up?  I mean, shit looked tense between the two of you, but I could see the chemistry immediately. What the hell happened?”

Chris let out another deep breath, clasping his hands together.  “Hollywood happened.  One minute I’m texting and calling her every day.  The next I get an actress girlfriend who is insecure as fuck about me being close with a friend who’s a girl.  And I just….fuck I don’t know.  The celebrity life got the best of me when I was in my 20’s.”

The two men looked over to see Jessica playing beer pong.  She was smiling and laughing along with the other guys, having the time of her life.  Chris smiled but still felt sad and like a total asshole for what he did to her. From such a young age, his heart belonged to her.  He used to think the two of them would get married one day; have a family together. But he knew he fucked that all up now.

“Jess is really forgiving. Just talk to her.  Tell her the truth.”

“I don’t know man.  I mean, it’s been fucking years since I’ve talked to her before today.  There’s no excuse I could say to make this any better.”

“If I know Jessica the way I do, she’s getting tired and going to want to go home.  Offer to take her home and talk to her.  Just seeing you two next to each other-you seem like the perfect pair.”

That got a chuckle from Chris.  

In a matter of minutes, Jessica came up to Sebastian, telling him she was ready to go home.  

~~~

A yawn escaped your lips as you looked at your phone.  Yep, time to get your ass back home and into bed.  

Sebastian was still talking to Chris, and no matter how much you didn’t want to go over there, you had to say goodbye to Sebastian.  

Grabbing your purse and jacket, you made your way through the small crowd and to the couch where the boys were sitting.  

“It’s getting late. I’m going to head home,” you said with a soft smile.  

You saw Sebastian nudge Chris.  “I can take you home,” Chris pipped up with hopeful eyes.  

“No it’s ok.  I was going to order an Uber,” came your curt reply.

“I insist.  Please. I have a rental car.  You don’t need to waste money on an Uber.”

As much as your mind was screaming at you to say no, to just walk away from this right now, your heart was telling you the complete opposite.  Nodding your head, you gave Sebastian a hug.  

“We’re going to talk about this,” he whispered in your ear.  You knew he was mad about you not telling him about Chris, and you damn well knew you were going to get an earful about it; probably bright and early tomorrow.

You and Chris walked silently downstairs and out into the cool night air.  You followed him until he stopped in front of his rental, opening the passenger car door for you.  

Without a moment’s notice, your breath hitched at the sight of the front passenger seat.  Your palms began to sweat as your breathing came up short. Chris noticed and you were quickly wrapped up in his strong arms.  

“Shit Jess.  I’m such an idiot.  I completely forgot about this,” Chris’ voice was soothing.  

After your parents were killed by a drunk driver, it had been difficult for you to be anywhere near the front seat of a car.  You usually took trains, Ubers, or walked everywhere.  There wasn’t much a need for cars in New York City.  The last time you were in the front seat of a car was after your parents’ accident and you had a panic attack.  Lisa was driving, Chris was in the backseat and she had to pull over to calm you down.  Ever since then, it’s only been backseats for you as you just felt more comfortable that way.

“Do you want to sit in the backseat?” Chris’ voice broke you from your thoughts.  You gave him a slight nod as he closed the door and opened the door to the backseat.  

You got in and buckled yourself as Chris got into the driver’s seat.  You gave him your address and he typed it into his phone.

Before you knew it, you were pulled up outside your apartment building.  

“Thanks for the ride Chris,” you said as you unbuckled yourself.  

“Can I come in?  Can we talk?” Chris asked from the front seat; his eyes glued to you in the rearview mirror.  

Your motions stilled as you fought with what to say.  You wanted nothing more than to bring him inside and have your way with him. Whether that meant to kiss him, or to scream at him, you had no idea.  In the end, your heart won over.  

“Yeah.  Ok,” you softly spoke.  

Pulling your keys from your purse you unlocked the door to the building.  Chris trailed behind you as the two of you climbed the stairs to your floor.  You turned to look at him, giving him a soft smile as you continued walking down the hall. As you reached your apartment door, you sighed deeply before unlocking the door.  

The two of you walked in and immediately Chris began to look around at his surroundings.  It wasn’t much, but it was home.  Your apartment had one bathroom and one bathroom.  Just big enough for you.  Rent was expensive in New York City, but as a photographer who photographed celebrities and special events, you made enough to live comfortably.  

Chris began to look at your shelves and the pictures they bestowed.  As much as you wanted to have pictures of the two of you; which you did have, you had to take them down as it hurt too much to look at them.  Instead, you had pictures of your parents, and ones with you and some of the Evans family.  

He stopped in front of one picture with you, Lisa, Carly and Shanna.  Chris took it off the shelf, as he smiled.  “This is a great picture.”  

Walking over to him, you chuckled.  “That was a great day.  Us girls went to the spa and got pampered.  I need another one of those days.”

“You know, my mom talks about you constantly whenever I’m on the phone with her.  She’s always bragging about how good of a photographer you are.  She misses you.”

That broke your heart. You hadn’t seen Lisa or any of the Evans siblings in nearly a year.  It was too hard to go back home.  Your house had been rented out since you moved to New York City; not ready to sell it just yet.  In fact, you were going back home to Sudbury next week as the tenants moved out and you were finally ready to sell.  It was a big house and you no matter how much you wanted to keep it; New York was home to you now and you couldn’t imagine living in such an elaborately big house by yourself.  

“Yeah I know.  But I’ll see her next week,” you remarked. Chris looked at you with furrowed brows. “I’m selling the house so I need to get some cleaning and staging done.”

Chris looked sad at your words.  But there was nothing he could do to change your mind.  

“Have you put it up for sale yet?” he asked.  

Shaking your head, you replied.  “Not yet. I wanted to get some cleaning done. I’ll be there next week and then I have a real estate agent coming over the week after that.”

Chris put the picture back onto the shelf before turning to you.  His eyes looked pained as he took you in.  The two of you staring at one another; no words spoken.  He was so beautiful and no matter how hard you tried to block all the feelings, you knew deep down, he still held your heart.  

Your chin began to quiver as you turned your back to him.  Breathing deeply, you clenched your eyes shut.  It hurt you so much to be this close to him, yet knowing he threw you away after just a few years of being in the spotlight.  

Turning back to face him, your eyes were glossed over with tears.  “Why Chris?” you choked out.  “Why did you just toss me aside like I meant nothing to you?”

Chris slumped onto the couch, placing his head into his large hands.  He took a few deep breaths before looking up at you with tear filled eyes.  

Tag List: @chrisevansfanfic @jinoraskies @patzammit @brastrangled @miss-cap21 @princess-evans-addict @pumbibaby @guera31 @kanupps06 @zohoffman @the-real-kellymonster @white-chocolate-mocha-fan @remember-that-one-blog @sincerelyfan @hispeculiartreasure @libbitinasdeath @projectxhappiness @ssweet-empowerment @sfreeborn @poerebel @jjlevin @badassbaker @sophiealiice @mrs-captain-evans @crushed-pink-petals @supernatural-girl97 @laochbaineann @esoltis280 @coffeebooksandfandom @joannie95 @3dsaunt

trail.content_raw:
Pairings: Chris Evans x OFC

Warnings:  Angst, Swearing

Summary: After losing touch with your childhood best friend after graduation, he comes crashing back into your life 15 years later. The feelings you’ve had for him never left you.  But do you forgive him for all those years he ignored you?  Or do you decide he lost his chance with you for good?

[[MORE]]

“Jess,” his soft voice bringing you back to reality.  

Slowly you turned around, your gaze moving up his body and to his face.  When your eyes mixed with his, it felt like the wind was knocked out of you.  He was more handsome than ever.  From all the years playing Captain America, he really bulked up his body.  His muscles pressed tightly against his black t-shirt; drool practically seeping from your lips at the sight of him.  

“Hi,” you breathed out softly.  Chris stuffed his hands into his front pockets, a lop sided grin on his face.  

“Hey.”  You were unsure of what to even say, and it seemed the same for Chris.  You were able to read him like an open book as a look of guilt popped onto his beautiful face.  “How have you been?”  he asked with a slight nervous tinge to his voice.  

You shrugged, looking down at your feet.  “I’ve been ok.”  Looking back into his eyes, you just wanted to scream and kiss him at the same time. “You?”

Chris’ eyes met yours; a hint of sadness behind them.  “Umm, yeah I’ve been good.  Working a lot so that’s kept me pretty busy.”

“Mmmm,” was all you managed to say with a raise of your brows.  Of course he was ‘so’ busy that he couldn’t even bother to text or call you back after so many years.  

“Look Jess…” he began to say when the door to the balcony opened.  

“Hey Jess, you wanna play another round of beer pong and be on my team this time?” Chace asked with a smile.  Your own relieved smile spread across your face.  

“I’d love to,” you replied. Looking back to Chris, you gave him a tight smile.  “I’ll see you around.”  It nearly broke your heart to be so short with your responses to him; but he broke your heart years ago by just forgetting about you.  

~~~

“YES!” you cheered, raising your hands in the air as you sunk the last ball making you and Chace the winners.  

“Holy shit girl you are the best beer pong partner EVER!” he roared as he picked you up in his arms and spun you around.  You giggled but soon felt yourself get dizzy from all the drinking and spinning around. Luckily Chace set you down quickly.

Glancing around the apartment, you saw Chris and Sebastian sitting together on the couch.  They were talking quietly to one another.  You couldn’t help but think what they were talking about.  

~~~

“I can’t believe she didn’t tell me,” Sebastian sighed, taking another sip of his drink.  “We’ve been so close for the past decade and she never brought it up.”

Chris looked to the floor; his elbows on his knees.  “Don’t sweat it too much man.  It’s my fault really.”

Sebastian looked at Chris, his brows raised in question.  “What the hell does that mean?

Chris let out a deep sigh, shaking his head.  “I mean I royally fucked up Seb.  We remained close for a few years after I moved here to go to school.  But once I got my first acting job, I just became so busy wanting to be with all these women that I slowly stopped texting her.”

Sebastian’s mouth hung open. “Are you fucking kidding me right now? You’ve known the girl since you were what, five, and you just decide to up and ignore her?  She’s like the greatest person on this planet!”

“You don’t think I know that Seb?  She’s like the best thing that ever happened to me.”

“Then how could you fuck this up?  I mean, shit looked tense between the two of you, but I could see the chemistry immediately. What the hell happened?”

Chris let out another deep breath, clasping his hands together.  “Hollywood happened.  One minute I’m texting and calling her every day.  The next I get an actress girlfriend who is insecure as fuck about me being close with a friend who’s a girl.  And I just….fuck I don’t know.  The celebrity life got the best of me when I was in my 20’s.”

The two men looked over to see Jessica playing beer pong.  She was smiling and laughing along with the other guys, having the time of her life.  Chris smiled but still felt sad and like a total asshole for what he did to her. From such a young age, his heart belonged to her.  He used to think the two of them would get married one day; have a family together. But he knew he fucked that all up now.

“Jess is really forgiving. Just talk to her.  Tell her the truth.”

“I don’t know man.  I mean, it’s been fucking years since I’ve talked to her before today.  There’s no excuse I could say to make this any better.”

“If I know Jessica the way I do, she’s getting tired and going to want to go home.  Offer to take her home and talk to her.  Just seeing you two next to each other-you seem like the perfect pair.”

That got a chuckle from Chris.  

In a matter of minutes, Jessica came up to Sebastian, telling him she was ready to go home.  

~~~

A yawn escaped your lips as you looked at your phone.  Yep, time to get your ass back home and into bed.  

Sebastian was still talking to Chris, and no matter how much you didn’t want to go over there, you had to say goodbye to Sebastian.  

Grabbing your purse and jacket, you made your way through the small crowd and to the couch where the boys were sitting.  

“It’s getting late. I’m going to head home,” you said with a soft smile.  

You saw Sebastian nudge Chris.  “I can take you home,” Chris pipped up with hopeful eyes.  

“No it’s ok.  I was going to order an Uber,” came your curt reply.

“I insist.  Please. I have a rental car.  You don’t need to waste money on an Uber.”

As much as your mind was screaming at you to say no, to just walk away from this right now, your heart was telling you the complete opposite.  Nodding your head, you gave Sebastian a hug.  

“We’re going to talk about this,” he whispered in your ear.  You knew he was mad about you not telling him about Chris, and you damn well knew you were going to get an earful about it; probably bright and early tomorrow.

You and Chris walked silently downstairs and out into the cool night air.  You followed him until he stopped in front of his rental, opening the passenger car door for you.  

Without a moment’s notice, your breath hitched at the sight of the front passenger seat.  Your palms began to sweat as your breathing came up short. Chris noticed and you were quickly wrapped up in his strong arms.  

“Shit Jess.  I’m such an idiot.  I completely forgot about this,” Chris’ voice was soothing.

“Yeah.  Ok,” you softly spoke.

As you reached your apartment door, you sighed deeply before unlocking the door.  

The two of you walked in and immediately Chris began to look around at his surroundings.  It wasn’t much, but it was home.  Your apartment had one bathroom and one bathroom.  Just big enough for you.  Rent was expensive in New York City, but as a photographer who photographed celebrities and special events, you made enough to live comfortably.

He stopped in front of one picture with you, Lisa, Carly and Shanna.  Chris took it off the shelf, as he smiled.  “This is a great picture.”  

Walking over to him, you chuckled.  “That was a great day.  Us girls went to the spa and got pampered.  I need another one of those days.”

“You know, my mom talks about you constantly whenever I’m on the phone with her.  She’s always bragging about how good of a photographer you are.  She misses you.”

That broke your heart. You hadn’t seen Lisa or any of the Evans siblings in nearly a year.  It was too hard to go back home.  Your house had been rented out since you moved to New York City; not ready to sell it just yet.  In fact, you were going back home to Sudbury next week as the tenants moved out and you were finally ready to sell.  It was a big house and you no matter how much you wanted to keep it; New York was home to you now and you couldn’t imagine living in such an elaborately big house by yourself.  

“Yeah I know.  But I’ll see her next week,” you remarked. Chris looked at you with furrowed brows. “I’m selling the house so I need to get some cleaning and staging done.”

Chris looked sad at your words.  But there was nothing he could do to change your mind.  

“Have you put it up for sale yet?” he asked.  

Shaking your head, you replied.  “Not yet. I wanted to get some cleaning done. I’ll be there next week and then I have a real estate agent coming over the week after that.”

Chris put the picture back onto the shelf before turning to you.  His eyes looked pained as he took you in.  The two of you staring at one another; no words spoken.  He was so beautiful and no matter how hard you tried to block all the feelings, you knew deep down, he still held your heart.  

Your chin began to quiver as you turned your back to him.  Breathing deeply, you clenched your eyes shut.  It hurt you so much to be this close to him, yet knowing he threw you away after just a few years of being in the spotlight.  

Turning back to face him, your eyes were glossed over with tears.  “Why Chris?” you choked out.  “Why did you just toss me aside like I meant nothing to you?”

Chris slumped onto the couch, placing his head into his large hands.  He took a few deep breaths before looking up at you with tear filled eyes.

“Can I come in?  Can we talk?” Chris asked from the front seat; his eyes glued to you in the rearview mirror.  

Your motions stilled as you fought with what to say.  You wanted nothing more than to bring him inside and have your way with him. Whether that meant to kiss him, or to scream at him, you had no idea.  In the end, your heart won over.  

“Yeah.  Ok,” you softly spoke.  

Pulling your keys from your purse you unlocked the door to the building.  Chris trailed behind you as the two of you climbed the stairs to your floor.  You turned to look at him, giving him a soft smile as you continued walking down the hall. As you reached your apartment door, you sighed deeply before unlocking the door.  

The two of you walked in and immediately Chris began to look around at his surroundings.  It wasn’t much, but it was home.  Your apartment had one bathroom and one bathroom.  Just big enough for you.  Rent was expensive in New York City, but as a photographer who photographed celebrities and special events, you made enough to live comfortably.  

Chris began to look at your shelves and the pictures they bestowed.  As much as you wanted to have pictures of the two of you; which you did have, you had to take them down as it hurt too much to look at them.  Instead, you had pictures of your parents, and ones with you and some of the Evans family.  

He stopped in front of one picture with you, Lisa, Carly and Shanna.  Chris took it off the shelf, as he smiled.  “This is a great picture.”  

Walking over to him, you chuckled.  “That was a great day.  Us girls went to the spa and got pampered.  I need another one of those days.”

“You know, my mom talks about you constantly whenever I’m on the phone with her.  She’s always bragging about how good of a photographer you are.  She misses you.”

That broke your heart. You hadn’t seen Lisa or any of the Evans siblings in nearly a year.  It was too hard to go back home.  Your house had been rented out since you moved to New York City; not ready to sell it just yet.  In fact, you were going back home to Sudbury next week as the tenants moved out and you were finally ready to sell.  It was a big house and you no matter how much you wanted to keep it; New York was home to you now and you couldn’t imagine living in such an elaborately big house by yourself.  

“Yeah I know.  But I’ll see her next week,” you remarked. Chris looked at you with furrowed brows. “I’m selling the house so I need to get some cleaning and staging done.”

Chris looked sad at your words.  But there was nothing he could do to change your mind.  

“Have you put it up for sale yet?” he asked.  

Shaking your head, you replied.  “Not yet. I wanted to get some cleaning done. I’ll be there next week and then I have a real estate agent coming over the week after that.”

Chris put the picture back onto the shelf before turning to you.  His eyes looked pained as he took you in.  The two of you staring at one another; no words spoken.  He was so beautiful and no matter how hard you tried to block all the feelings, you knew deep down, he still held your heart.  

Your chin began to quiver as you turned your back to him.  Breathing deeply, you clenched your eyes shut.  It hurt you so much to be this close to him, yet knowing he threw you away after just a few years of being in the spotlight.  

Turning back to face him, your eyes were glossed over with tears.  “Why Chris?” you choked out.  “Why did you just toss me aside like I meant nothing to you?”

Chris slumped onto the couch, placing his head into his large hands.  He took a few deep breaths before looking up at you with tear filled eyes.

trail.content_abstract:
Pairings: Chris Evans x OFC

Warnings:  Angst, Swearing

Summary: After losing touch with your childhood best friend after graduation, he comes crashing back into your life 15 years later. The feelings you’ve had for him never left you.  But do you forgive him for all those years he ignored you?  Or do you decide he lost his chance with you for good?

tags: The sun may never shine on us again
summary: It just hit me that we may never get to see Chris Evans and RDJ be the characters we love on screen, to see their story grow and...
body: It just hit me that we may never get to see Chris Evans and RDJ be the characters we love on screen, to see their story grow and grow into a big gorgeous apple tree, each apple a new experience and a new quote. The sun may never shine on us again.
